snippet: Russia’s chief arms exporter said air and sea defenses could be used against any nation trying to halt Syria’s violence.
abstract: Rosoboronexport, Russia's chief arms exporter, announces that it is shipping advanced defensive missile systems to Syria that could be used to shoot down airplanes or sink ships if the United States or other nations try to intervene to halt the violence; weapons systems, which are not considered cutting edge, do not represent a military threat, but disclosure reinforces a diplomatic chill that has settled over relations between Russia and the US.
lead_paragraph: Russia’s chief arms exporter said air and sea defenses could be used against any nation trying to halt Syria’s violence.

headline.seo: Russia Sending Air and Sea Defenses to Syria
headline.main: Russia Sending Missile Systems to Shield Syria
headline.print_headline: Russia Sending Missile Systems To Shield Syria
